definition: one that draws: such as
a person who causes liquor to come out of a container : one who draws (see draw entry 1 sense 1b) liquor
draftsman
one that draws (see draw entry 1 sense transitive 7) a bill of exchange or order for payment or makes a promissory note

a sliding box or receptacle opened by pulling out and closed by pushing in                                      
             
             kept the letters in the top drawer of her dresser

an article of clothing (such as underwear) for the lower body                                      
             
             a clean pair of drawers
a box that slides into and out of a piece of furniture (such as a desk) and that is used to store things

underpants
the party that draws a draft  — compare drawee, payee

in the silverware drawer

the top drawer of the desk

a desk drawer

definition: a part of a piece of furniture that slides in and out and is used for keeping things in. A piece of furniture with a lot of drawers is called a chest of drawers
in: The photos are in the top drawer of my desk.

definition: a box-shaped container, without a top, that is part of a piece of furniture. It slides in and out to open and close and is used for keeping things in:

→ 
        
         underpants

a wide but not very deep container, open at the top, that is part of a piece of furniture and that a person can pull partly out from its front to put things in and then push back to make it even with the front of the furniture:
the person who writes a cheque telling their bank to pay an amount of money to someone:
the person who writes a bill of exchange telling someone to pay an amount of money at a stated time:
